programme.title: My Perfect Day
programme.desc: Kar is a selfless soul known for his unwavering commitment to the unhoused in his community. It's Kar's turn to have some good old-fashioned fun.

programme.title: West By Orphan Train
programme.desc: A gripping documentary uncovering real stories of children loaded on trains, sent west, and presented “for the picking.” From 1854 to 1929, over 6,000 children landed in Iowa communities. Discover their emotional journeys and impact on the Midwest.

programme.title: Matter of Fact
programme.desc: This week Matter of Fact travels to Washington state, where a new fellowship program is addressing a shortage of public defenders. Plus, the president of the National Job Corps Association on why she says it’s crucially important to keep the vocational training program open. And, we meet the members of a church group dedicated to people with special needs.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: From surfing the waves to surfing the shops, Justin and Ryan find a way to have both a good time and do a good deed in Oregon.

programme.title: Completed Episodes
programme.desc: A show first! A woman and her boyfriend each try their hand at Frank Nicotero's trivia questions to see who can win the most money.

programme.title: Maker Nation Challenge
programme.desc: Rain and chalk artists don't mix – and three Kansas City artists will not only have to take on the clock but the weather as they compete against each other to create art inspired by jazz – but how long can the dry pavement last?

programme.title: Weathering the Storm
programme.desc: On December 10, 2021, a violent tornado outbreak hit western Kentucky. It was the deadliest weather event in the history of the Commonwealth. But as families faced a bleak holiday season, hope emerged in surprising ways.

programme.title: Lowrider Legacy
programme.desc: Lowrider Legacy follows celebrated lowrider families, scholars, and activists and documents the history of resistance on wheels that has defined lowrider culture.

programme.title: Maddy & Dixie Take Sactown
programme.desc: Maddy & Dixie are always looking for that next new thing. Join them as they explore a few of Sactown's surprising offerings, from mobile archery to an intimate cocktail bar with over 700 bottles of unique liquor.

programme.title: KCRA Local News
programme.desc: Get the latest news and weather from KCRA.

programme.title: KCRA Game On: Fight for the Kings
programme.desc: Game On: Fight for the Kings is a KCRA 3 documentary with never-before-heard stories of the four-month fight, the friendships garnered between the rival cities, and Sacramento doing the unimaginable: winning the battle for the Kings.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: From paying ransoms to scouring hand-drawn treasure maps, these theft victims will do anything to recover their precious property.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Years ago Chef Bergen Carmen from Meril and Chef Aaron Villeda from Bao Mi worked side-by-side; now they’re back getting their hands dirty for some friendly competition. Will his old pal chicken liver turn out to be Chef Villeda’s ultimate downfall?

programme.title: Free Spirit
programme.desc: Kate explores gin and rituals with a master distiller, talks art and cocktails with an Indigenous painter, and gets a lesson in moving mixology on George R.R. Martin’s adventure train in the high-desert city of Santa Fe.

programme.title: Breaking Bread
programme.desc: What happens when you put an award-winning chef in a hospital kitchen? We’ll explore food’s incredible healing power. Then, at a Sacramento rice farm, chefs and friends gather to demonstrate first-hand the farm-to-fork culture of the region.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: You can run. You can hide. But chances are, they’re still gonna find you. These are some of the wildest and most bizarre police captures on record.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: A fugitive escapes through the ceiling. A man plows his car into the police station. These shocking stories prove cops don't even have to leave the building to encounter the unpredictable.

programme.title: Bringing Down The House: The Bombing of Harvey's Casino
programme.desc: In the summer of 1980, two men wheeled what looked like an IBM computer into a Lake Tahoe casino. The events that followed rocked the industry, baffled bomb technicians, and changed the lives of a criminal’s and a casino magnate’s family forever.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: From a car crashing into a home to a lemur fleeing a DUI scene, these captivating real-life stories explore intense arrests caught on film.

programme.title: Hit Me With Your Best Spot
programme.desc: Local Kansas City notables Chef Shanita, Don Daughtry Sr., and the owners of Duet share where to go for cinnamon whiskey, an immersive historical experience, yoga with plants in paradise and more!

programme.title: Maker Nation Challenge
programme.desc: Three of Orlando’s finest glass artists take on the challenge of creating an original design celebrating "The City Beautiful," but will a bird-brained twist push them to their melting point, and who will emerge victorious?

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Chefs Nate Schoedel and Ivan Gil-Silva are casting their nets for the best Catch of the Day dishes in today's seafood showdown. Can our chefs reel in a victory? Or will they let the big one get away?

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: You can feel the love on this week’s culinary showdown. Chef Amy Mehrtens, Executive Chef of Copper Vine, challenges long-time friend Chef Daren Porretto, Chef de Cuisine at Saint John. While these two go back years, when it comes to competition they’re pulling no punches.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: Join Rob on an rugged outdoor adventure as he pushes himself to the limit from skydiving to ziplining in some of New England’s most scenic spots.

programme.title: Completed Episodes
programme.desc: Sharing a meal is a simple act. But it also fosters connection. This episode features a chef chopping down barriers, a coffee shop serving cups of compassion, a supermarket displaying representation on its shelves and much more.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: From a 300-year-old violin valued at $6 million, to thousands of rare books, thieves will go to wild, even dangerous, lengths to snatch up irreplaceable treasures. For investigators, it's a race against the clock to recover these priceless valuables.

programme.title: Weathering the Storm
programme.desc: On December 10, 2021, a violent tornado outbreak hit western Kentucky. It was the deadliest weather event in the history of the Commonwealth. But as families faced a bleak holiday season, hope emerged in surprising ways.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Three years after his double amputation, Jeff in Albuquerque is ready to reconnect with nature. Kinga is there to root him on as he takes on challenging and inspiring outdoor adventures.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: Frank Nicotero quizzes people about real news stories with unreal outcomes for a chance to win money. In "Surprising Sights," contestants learn about a strange seal rescue, a bizarre landmark and a wild wedding prank.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Butter, burgers, bacon… eggplant? There are many definitions of “comfort food,” but only one winner when Chef Keith Swiryn takes on Chef Garett Rodriguez in this classic dining challenge.

programme.title: Only In

programme.title: Finding Adventure

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness

programme.title: Human Race by Runner's World
programme.desc: Runner-in-Chief Jeff Dengate, presents inspiring runner stories from around the country. Meet runners from Colorado, New Jersey, Kentucky and Pennsylvania who are making a difference.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: Growing up, two siblings hear unsettling stories about their family's history. They don't know what to believe about the ones who went missing in 1992, until, decades later, the haunting truth comes out.

programme.title: What's On The Menu?
programme.desc: Sourcing high-quality, fresh ingredients can be a challenge in an urban area like Pittsburgh. Meet chefs and restaurant owners who are going the extra mile to serve up fresh farm-to-table cuisine.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Drink some ‘shockingly’ good brew. Ride shotgun in a motorcycle sidecar as you tour the local wine country. Share a life-size mimosa with a friend and fall asleep on a working farm where you can literally count sheep.

programme.title: In Transit by Esquire
programme.desc: Esquire’s Dave Holmes chats with Drag Race’s Peppermint and shares an Esquire-approved itinerary for your next trip to Sacramento.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Everybody loves a hearty breakfast for dinner, but will Chef Sean Rumery or Chef Collin Torres most impress the judges with their elevated spin on a classic? Find out on this egg-cellent episode of Plate It!

programme.title: Sports Town Stories
programme.desc: From ice hockey to lacrosse to tennis, Baltimore coaches help drive the next generation to find family, inspiration and pride through sports.

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: Entre, a single dad and musician, searches for his perfect partner in Des Moines. Three bachelorettes compete for a coveted second date. From spirited bar games and paddling on the lake to sweet bakery moments, who will take the cake?

programme.title: Absolutely Albuquerque
programme.desc: Amanda joins Sage Cornelius, an Indigenous fiddle player with a love for heavy metal. Watch as they spend the day exploring the city’s rich Vietnamese food scene, an impromptu concert at a favorite local venue, and a bit of supervised mayhem.

programme.title: Completed Episodes
programme.desc: Indulge in the old-school classics that have reigned in the Midwest for decades. From Wisconsin cheese curds to Kansas City's burnt ends, enjoy these unique comfort foods that are as timeless as they are tasty.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A Missouri community seeks answers when two young women disappear a decade apart

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Visit a peachy brewery that uses local farm ingredients, then devour a massive biscuit sandwich. In Lexington, South Carolina you can have a close encounter with an exotic animal at a drive-thru safari before checking into an Italian villa in the heart of downtown.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: After giving away thousands of tattoos to Chaos & Kindness fans, Justin and Ryan hit the kitchen to make cookies to share across New Hampshire.

programme.title: Grit of Greenwood
programme.desc: Greenwood was a thriving Black district in Tulsa when, 100 years ago, it was destroyed in less than 24 hours.

programme.title: Absolutely Albuquerque
programme.desc: With award-winning Chef Marie Yniguez, Amanda forages for wild ingredients along the Rio Grande, makes paletas—Mexican popsicles— from scratch, and enters a high pressure cooking competition.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: To Grandma's House we go! Chefs Mike Boggs and Nancy Longo face off, cooking up their favorite family recipes, but can they remember how Grandma used to make it?

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: After transitioning and battling cancer, Madison Wilkins finally feels comfortable in her own skin. Kinga goes to Orlando, Florida to help Madison let her hair down and experience adventure as the woman she’s always longed to be.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: The team sets out on a Chaos and Kindness road trip, committing to doing good at every stop, with a very special musical guest joining them at the end.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Jessy Melo of Jessy’s Clean Meals is back for redemption. Can Chef Nikki Irving, owner of Los Jefes Comida in Taunton, show how she too, can elevate clean and fresh cooking to a higher level or will the blindfold be a game changer?

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: One evening in 1999, Cythnia Jaramillo shows up at a home wearing nothing but a dog collar. She had been tortured and sexually assaulted for days. Her escape leads investigators to discover a gruesome string of kidnappings and murders.

programme.title: Sports Town Stories
programme.desc: Whether it's a wrestling star training through grief, champion rollerskaters challenged on the world stage, or a cycling team pushing through obstacles, Iowans don't back down when the going gets tough.

programme.title: Human Race by Runner's World
programme.desc: 84% of women have been harassed while running. Not Today, by Runner's World, examines this through the stories of three runners. Mollie Tibbetts and Wendy Martinez were both brutally murdered, while Kelly Herron fought off her attacker and survived.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: There are no bounds to what women can achieve. In this episode, we highlight women from across the country who are fearless go-getters, helpers and even life-savers.

programme.title: My Amazing Cheap Date
programme.desc: Two couples sample bites from around the world, cozy up in nature, get hopped up on caffeine and seek out a yoga glow on two blind dates in Orlando.

programme.title: Hit Me With Your Best Spot: Marvel Actor, TikTok Fitness Mom, & Top Comedian Find Thrills at Theme Park
programme.desc: Our local experts know the best thrills at Fun Spot. Orlando’s top comedian braves the gravity-defying SkyCoaster, a monster DJ and actor can’t stop screaming on White Lightning, and an influencer leaves all her followers behind on the go-kart track.

programme.title: Completed Episodes
programme.desc: Recording artist, Corey Pieper celebrates his Hawaiian heritage as he shows Greg the tropical island side of Milwaukee. Together they take a winter surfing lesson, build a new surfboard, and end the day preparing a traditional Hawaiian meal.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Cyber-burglars, a dangerous mix of con artist and geek, wreak havoc on the technologically vulnerable. Our experts offer tips to spot such high-tech trickery before it's too late.

programme.title: The Spark
programme.desc: From home brewing to their rise as one of the most awarded breweries in Greenville, Nicole and Brian Cendrowski’s story is one of trial by fire as they strive to forge a unique, community-driven brewery.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Step out of your comfort zone, be bold and daring and challenge yourself. Through these journeys, thrill-seekers gain priceless skills and knowledge, even helping make the world a better place.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: Sierra Lamar leaves for school one morning and vanishes with barely a trace, setting in motion one of the largest searches in U.S. history. The community and investigators still have unanswered questions.

programme.title: Weathering the Storm
programme.desc: On December 10, 2021, a violent tornado outbreak hit western Kentucky. It was the deadliest weather event in the history of the Commonwealth. But as families faced a bleak holiday season, hope emerged in surprising ways.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: After a South Carolina couple vanishes, social media posts begin cropping up claiming the pair is fine and eloped. But their loved ones are convinced they're not the ones who penned the posts, and the truth is more shocking than anyone imagined.

programme.title: On The Job
programme.desc: Brendan wields the baton leading the orchestra, achieves his dream of performing with a cast of Queens, and serves up das boot with German local legends.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Put your best wooden clog forward and celebrate this small Iowa town's Dutch heritage. Take in the view from an authentic windmill. Check in to a bed and breakfast famous for its delicious "babies."

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Kinga is in Manchester, NH, to meet Matt Krajcik, a 26-year-old curriculum developer who survived a trying childhood. Now he is looking to reconnect to the nature around him that provided respite when he was young.

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: Randi, a 29-year-old single from Omaha, is ready to date three lovely ladies. Will she find a connection with Karen, will Leia pull all the right heartstrings or will things get spicy with Emily?

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: One local single experiences some of the best their city has to offer on three blind dates. Our singles may spend three perfect days out on the town, but there can only be one love match. Who will be picked for a second date?

programme.title: Unbelievable
programme.desc: Brace yourself for heart-stopping heroics as rescuers leap into action! A semi-truck teeters dangerously over the Ohio River, a devastating gas explosion reduces homes to rubble, and a capsized cargo ship leaves its crew fighting for survival.

programme.title: West By Orphan Train
programme.desc: A gripping documentary uncovering real stories of children loaded on trains, sent west, and presented “for the picking.” From 1854 to 1929, over 6,000 children landed in Iowa communities. Discover their emotional journeys and impact on the Midwest.

programme.title: Always Remember Your Name
programme.desc: A documentary of mistaken identity, hope, love, and the power of story by two Holocaust survivors.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: In this game show, comedian Frank Nicotero hits the streets to ask people questions inspired by the wildest news stories for a chance at winning a cash prize. These real-life stories with unreal outcomes will make you say, “Wait, What Happened?"

programme.title: Refugees Welcome: A Story of Immigration to America’s Heartland
programme.desc: Refugees Welcome documents how one Governor’s brave decision to welcome refugees during the Vietnam War had far reaching repercussions not only for the country but, generations later, for the fate of his own family.

programme.title: Underdog Uprising
programme.desc: Every game day, fans pour into the stands to cheer on New Mexico's soccer team. But these are no ordinary supporters. From the Curse, to Sektor 114, to the Black Diamonds these fans are making New Mexico United.

programme.title: My Perfect Day
programme.desc: Chris has an unstoppable spirit, despite the challenges of Down syndrome. His resilience has propelled him to extraordinary achievements, including clinching the gold in Greece. Meaghan takes him on a whirlwind of experiences tailored just for him.

programme.title: Heroes On Call
programme.desc: In the 1960s, Americans were dying at shocking rates due to inadequate emergency care. Enter Freedom House Ambulance Service: the first paramedics unit in the U.S., run and staffed by Black men and women. This is the origin story of EMS.

programme.title: My Amazing Cheap Date
programme.desc: Host and comedic actor Amy Brassette McKeon challenges two sets of couples to pass a good time on a dime in their city. Find out which couple will experience the most amazing date for under fifty bucks.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Watch things heat up in the kitchen as two local chefs go head-to-head to create a three-course meal utilizing ingredients sourced from one of the city’s unique marketplaces.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: Join host Rob Mariano, also known as Boston Rob from the Survivor series, as he explores the best of Beantown from classic institutions to new local gems.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Experience serious vacation vibes and discover some of the most special corners of America on this guided tour of must-visit cities.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Join New Hampshire-based band Recycled Percussion as they perform acts of kindness in their community, and across the country. In each episode, you'll witness the great lengths and hilarious things they're willing to do in the name of kindness.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A true crime series telling the story of unfathomable crimes that have rocked American communities leaving them forever changed.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Stitch showcases the feel-good and do-good that make up the fabric of America from inspiring tales of perseverance, to good Samaritans helping neighbors, to trailblazers improving their communities.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chefs recreate each other’s signature dish, but they can only determine what the dish is using their senses of taste, touch and smell. When the masks come off, the heat is on, with each chef attempting to cook their opponent’s creation.
